contentfulPagePressRelease.title: ABP Recognizes Outstanding Students at Honors Assembly

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Students, administrators, and staff gathered at Qatar Foundation’sAcademic Bridge Program (ABP) in recognition of the outstanding academic achievement of students during the opening six weeks of the first semester.

The ABP held an honors assembly to recognize the students who had distinguished themselves in their academic studies in the first marking period.

Seven students obtained high honors, 56 students achieved honors, and 19 students had perfect attendance.To receive high honors, a student needs to have an average of 90 percent or above and grades in all classes had to be above 90 percent.

To receive honors, a student needs to have an average of 80 percent or above and grades in all classes had to be above 80 percent.

For the full story, please click here.

pageContext.title: ABP Recognizes Outstanding Students at Honors Assembly
